children.text: Our lessons and resources are designed to give teachers all the tools they need to plan their lessons. Find out more about Oak’s lesson planning resources and how you can adapt them for your class and school here.

intro.title: IGNORE THIS TITLE - Need to configure hidden fields

children.text:
We believe that when we share the knowledge of every teacher, and you make it your own, pupils up and down the country will benefit. That’s why we’re putting the best curriculum thinking, the deepest subject expertise, and the smartest learning design at your fingertips.

From Early Years to Key Stage 4, we provide free access to thousands of teacher-made, fully-resourced lessons to adapt and use with your pupils, in school or remotely. We’ll be updating these soon - find out more below.

video.title: Some video from the library because it's the only one I can find

children.text: Created in April 2020 as a rapid response to the coronavirus outbreak, we brought together a group of partners committed to supporting schools’ efforts to keep children learning.
In less than 2 years we've developed 40,000+ resources with the support of 550 teachers and delivered over 150 million lessons in our online classroom.

As the new national curriculum body we'll work with a diverse range of experts and partners to identify brilliant models and expertise from across the system and share them with you as new sets of fully resourced units and lessons for you to adapt and use with your pupils.
Oak is by teachers, for teachers; our work isn’t buffeted by the political winds of the day. Our board is publicly appointed, and our partners selected through an open process.
Schools and teachers know their pupils best, so we want them to continue to think deeply about the curriculum and choosing if and how they use us.
Oak’s resources and curricula will be fully adaptable because no model can suit every teacher or pupil in every context.
Oak will always be free - because access to a great education shouldn’t be based on who can afford to pay.

Our leadership team brings together multidisciplinary experts in education, technology, school support and operations to deliver on Oak's strategy, and ensure value for money for the public. Learn more about them below.

Our interim Board is independent of the Department for Education. It safeguards our independence, as well as providing strategic direction and scrutiny to the leadership team. Our future Board will be chosen through a public appointments process.

documents.title: Oak National Academy annual report and accounts for the period ended XX Month 2022

children.text: Oak National Academy is a limited company incorporated under the Companies Act 2006 in September 2022 and whose sole shareholder is the Secretary of State for Education. It is a non-departmental public body (NDPB) which was established to work with schools, teachers and the wider education system and has a framework agreement with the Department for Education

From humble roots, we’ve grown into a national resource, reaching millions of teachers and pupils. It wouldn’t have been possible without the brilliant work of the talented teachers, curriculum partners and technlogy partners that have supported us. Thank you.

We’re excited to be at the heart of this new national collaboration, but no one can do this alone. A team is required. So if you’re as excited as we are – brilliant. We want to hear from you. There’s lots of ways to get involved - find out more below.
We're hiring! If you share our values, and want to help make a difference, then join one of our remote-based teams: Education, Operations, Product & Engineering and School Support
We're looking for a diverse range of experts to assess the evidence, and agree rigorous quality standards, specific for each subject.
If you've got a great curriculum, we'll be selecting partners to work with us across 14 subjects areas: Primary and Secondary Maths, Science, English, History, Geography and Music. [hubspot form].
Oak has always listened and responded to teachers; have your say by taking part in research with us, or by road-testing our resources in your school [hubspot form].

General enquiries
For general enquiries and help please email help@thenational.academy.

Media enquiries
For media enquiries, please contact media@thenational.academy.

Get support
You’ll find lots of help and support for teachers, schools, pupils and parents in our Help Centre [link to Help Centre]
